p: The in vivo study demonstrated that H 2O 2 given in the drinking water (0.5%) causes significant increase in AST and ALT, decreases total protein and albumin, and an elevation of blood urea levels [ 35]. Another study showed that administration of H 2O 2 (0.1%) in drinking water in rats for 25 weeks induced an increase in the malondialdehyde levels, catalase activity, superoxide dismutase and glutathione peroxidase in organs [ 36].
